item.title: About
item.description: Hello there My name is Strahinja. I’m a third year Computer Engineering student at the School of Electrical Engineering, University of Belgrade. I started programming at the age of 14 when I developed my first Minecraft plugin, which became my passion that I kept pursuing all the way through high school. This passion for programming Minecraft plugins helped me become proficient in the Java programming language. At that time I got interested in backend web development, which led me to learn about NodeJS, databases and Typescript.
item.content:
Hello there

My name is Strahinja.

I’m a third year Computer Engineering student at the School of Electrical Engineering, University of Belgrade.

I started programming at the age of 14 when I developed my first Minecraft plugin, which became my passion that I kept pursuing all the way through high school. This passion for programming Minecraft plugins helped me become proficient in the Java programming language. At that time I got interested in backend web development, which led me to learn about NodeJS, databases and Typescript.

After I had been sharpening my Minecraft plugin programming skills for 3-4 years, I started working as a freelance Minecraft plugin developer, and worked through the latter years of high school. I wrote code that was responsible for interfacing with PostgreSQL for storing player data, and RabbitMQ for passing messages between server and proxy instances. I also learned how to use Git and build systems like Gradle.

In the year 2021, I enrolled at the University of Belgrade. During my first and second year of university I found my passion for low-level programming and hardware. I am currently working very hard on learning about operating systems, computer architecture and oragnization, as well as digital design.
